snippet: Facing discontent over her government’s preparations for the World Cup, President Dilma Rousseff defended the funding of new stadiums and said Brazilians planning to shun the event were a “small minority.”
abstract: Brazil's Pres Dilma Rousseff, facing discontent over her government's preparations for the 2014 World Cup, defends the funding of new stadiums and says the event offers an opportunity to strengthen the country's position on the global stage.
lead_paragraph: Facing discontent over her government’s preparations for the World Cup, President Dilma Rousseff defended the funding of new stadiums and said Brazilians planning to shun the event were a “small minority.”

headline.main: Brazilian President Rejects Criticism Over World Cup
headline.print_headline: Brazilian President Rejects Criticism Over World Cup
